name: Liver Imaging
description: The Liver Imaging Reporting and Data System (LI-RADS) was created to standardize the reporting and data collection of CT and MR imaging for hepatocellular carcinoma (HCC).

attributes.name: LI-RADS assessment category
attributes.description: Ordinal score assigned to an observation indicating its likelihood of hepatocellular carcinoma (HCC) or malignancy.

values.name: Definitely benign
values.description:
100% certainty observation is benign.  

Observation with: Imaging features diagnostic of a benign entity
or Definite spontaneous disappearance at follow up

Examples: Observations that may be categorized as LR-1: definite benign entities.

Reporting: LR-1 observations may be reported at radiologist’s discretion.
Since LR-1 observations are definitely benign, they may be reported or not reported at the radiologist's discretion
LR-1 observations may be reported in aggregate.

values.name: Probably benign
values.description:
High likelihood observation is benign.

Observation with imaging features suggestive but not diagnostic of a benign entity.

Examples:  Observations that may be categorized as LR-2: probable benign entities.

Reporting:  

LR-2 observations may be reported at the radiologist’s discretion.

Since LR-2 observations are likely benign, they may be reported or not reported at the radiologist's discretion.

LR-2 observations may be reported in aggregate.

Management implications:

Continued routine surveillance usually is appropriate.

values.name: Intermediate probability for HCC
values.description:
Observation that does not meet unequivocal criteria for other LI-RADS categories. 

Criteria:  Not definite benign entity, not probable benign entity, not non-HCC malignancy, not tumor in vein and one of the following:

Mass with hepatic arterial phase hypo- or isoenhancement
< 20mm mass with ≤ 1 of following: “washout”, “capsule”, and threshold growth
≥ 20mm mass with none of following: “washout”, “capsule”, and threshold growth
Mass with hepatic arterial phase hyperenhancement
< 20mm mass with none of following: “washout”, “capsule”, and  threshold growth

values.name: Probably HCC
values.description: Observation with imaging features suggestive but not diagnostic of HCC.

values.name: Definitely HCC
values.description: Observation with imaging features diagnostic of HCC.

values.name: Definite tumor in vein
values.description:
Observation associated with definite tumor in vein.

Criterion: Definite enhancing soft tissue in vein.

values.name: Probably malignant, not specific for HCC
values.description: Observation with one or more imaging features that favor non-HCC malignancy.

values.name: Treated observation
values.description:
An observation that has undergone loco-regional treatment.

Comments: 
LR-Treated does not imply that loco-regional treatment was successful.
Residual or recurrent HCC may be present.

attributes.name: Tumor in vein
attributes.description: Presence of tumor in vein lumen.

attributes.name: Diameter
attributes.description: The largest dimension (outer edge to outer edge) of an observation, measured in millimeters.

attributes.name: Arterial phase hyperenhancement
attributes.description: Enhancement in the arterial phase that unequivocally is greater than that of liver.

attributes.name: Capsule appearance
attributes.description: Peripheral rim of smooth hyper-enhancement in the portal venous phase ordelayed phase that unequivocally is thicker or more conspicuous than the rim's surrounding background nodule.

attributes.name: Threshold growth
attributes.description:
Increase in diameter of a mass compared to its baseline by a minimum of 5 mm AND depending on the time interval between examinations, by the following amounts:
  • <6 months: >50% diameter increase
  • >6 months: >100% diameter increase

attributes.name: Washout
attributes.description: Enhancement in the portal venous or delayed phases that unequivocally is less than that of liver.

attributes.name: Hepatobiliary phase hypointensity
attributes.description: Intensity in the hepatobiliary phase that unequivocally is less than that of the surrounding liver.

attributes.name: Mild-moderate T2 hyperintensity
attributes.description: Having mildly or moderately higher signal intensity on T2w images than liver.

attributes.name: T2 signal intensity
attributes.description: Signal intensity relative to liver on T2w images.

attributes.name: Restricted diffusion
attributes.description: Having higher signal intensity, not attributable solely to T2 shine-through, than liver on diffusion-weighted (DW) images.

attributes.name: Mosaic architecture
attributes.description: Observation that appears to consist of nodules or compartments with differing appearances (enhancement, attenuation, intensity).  This term can also be applied to lesions with internal enhancing septations. The nodules, compartments, or septations appear randomly distributed within the observation.

attributes.name: Intralesional fat
attributes.description: Presence of lipid in higher concentration within a mass than in background reference tissue (e.g., liver).
